meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, she felt indisposed and had to lie down.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised rest for the indisposed patient to recover quickly.
meanings.sent3: Despite feeling indisposed, he tried to play soccer but ended up needing a break.
meanings.sent4: Her indisposed condition made her miss the important meeting.
meanings.sent5: The indisposed child's pale face showed how unwell he was.

meanings.sent1: She was indisposed to attend the party due to her shyness.
meanings.sent2: The cat seemed indisposed to come out from under the bed.
meanings.sent3: Even though she was indisposed, her friends convinced her to join the dance.
meanings.sent4: His indisposed attitude towards change hindered his progress.
meanings.sent5: The student's indisposed nature towards public speaking was evident in her nervous gestures.

meanings.definition: Not disposed or inclined to do something
meanings.sent1: He was indisposed to help with the heavy lifting as he had a sore back.
meanings.sent2: The manager was indisposed to approve the budget without further details.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked indisposed to share its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her indisposed mood towards socializing was clear from her quiet demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The team was indisposed to take risks after their previous failure.
